alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Valley and southeastern Adams Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tamarack Ski Area, or 19 miles south of McCall, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tamarack Ski Area and northern Cascade Reservoir around 350 PM MDT. Donnelly around 400 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
